results.title: To do or not to do.....
results.creator_credit: Jock Noble and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: A digital story made as part of the ‘Diversity @ Work’ Program in association with AMES, Australia Post and SBS. Jock Noble, CEO of Diversity@work Australia, talks about the impact having Polio had on his childhood and how that has subsequently shaped his career in helping companies to strengthen through diversity in their workforce.

results.title: The Crying Game
results.creator_credit: John Wood and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description:
A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop Telling Tales. Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for Telling Tales.
This story made by John Wood talks about his uncontrallable bouts of crying. This is sometimes brought about by depression or anxiety. He has learned that the expression of emotion is very healthy.
results.description:

results.title: Why?
results.creator_credit: Tehree Gordon and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: A digital story made as part of the ‘Diversity @ Work’ Program in association with AMES, Australia Post and SBS. Tehree says she is an ordinary Australian, though she was a recipient of the Senior Australian of the Year Award in 2004. In this story, Tehree talks about her passion for wildlife from an early age leading to her founding Jirrahlinga Koala and Wildlife Sanctuary with her partner Hamish. The sanctuary has provided work opportunities and enrichment to people living with disabilities and the elderly.
results.description: A digital story made as part of the ‘Diversity @ Work’ Program in association with AMES, Australia Post and SBS. The sanctuary has provided work opportunities and enrichment to people living with disabilities and the elderly.

results.title: Birth without knives
results.brief_description:
Please note: This film contains footage of a home birth, including nudity.

Created by ‘Asphyxia’, this film talks about the concerns regarding pregnancy, avoiding a caesarean birth and having a home birth.

Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop ‘Telling Tales’.

results.title: Doors Will Open
results.creator_credit: Rajani Shrestha and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: A digital story made as part of the ‘Diversity @ Work’ Program in association with AMES, Australia Post and SBS. Rajani Shrestha moved to Melbourne from Nepal in 1992 with her husband and son. Rajani recounts the struggle she faced to find meaningful work in a new country. She tells of her journey which eventually led to her working at AMES Australia.
results.description: A digital story made as part of the ‘Diversity @ Work’ Program in association with AMES, Australia Post and SBS. She tells of her journey which eventually led to her working at AMES Australia.

results.title: My Banquet...
results.creator_credit: Chey Scovell and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: A digital story made as part of the ‘Diversity @ Work’ Program in association with AMES, Australia Post and SBS. Chey Scovell recounts his childhood growing up as an Australian born in Malaysia and the last four years of schooling spent in Papua New Guinea. He tells of the culture shock he experienced when returning back to Australia.

results.title: The Making of Florence - Episode 3
results.brief_description:
Expertly blending the visual novel and gaming genres, Florence illustrates one year in the life of a young woman in Melbourne as she falls in love, breaks her daily routine and follows her creative passion.

Developed by Australian craft games studio Mountains, Florence uses innovative gameplay mechanics to represent social interactions. The emotions of the poignant narrative are rendered through tapping and swiping minigames, making them all the more touching.

These interviews focus on how Mountains developed the musical score and tone of the game, working with game composer Kevin Penkin. This video features behind the scenes footage of the soundtrack’s recording session.

results.title: The Making of Florence - Episode 2
results.brief_description:
Expertly blending the visual novel and gaming genres, Florence illustrates one year in the life of a young woman in Melbourne as she falls in love, breaks her daily routine and follows her creative passion.

Developed by Australian craft games studio Mountains, Florence uses innovative gameplay mechanics to represent social interactions. The emotions of the poignant narrative are rendered through tapping and swiping minigames, making them all the more touching.

These interviews cover the overall creation process for Florence, focusing on how the developer creates a cohesive story through discussions, storyboarding, the art style, the music and the characters.

results.title: The Making of Florence - Episode 4
results.brief_description:
Expertly blending the visual novel and gaming genres, Florence illustrates one year in the life of a young woman in Melbourne as she falls in love, breaks her daily routine and follows her creative passion.

Developed by Australian craft games studio Mountains, Florence uses innovative gameplay mechanics to represent social interactions. The emotions of the poignant narrative are rendered through tapping and swiping minigames, making them all the more touching.

This video covers the leadup to the first public look of Florence at PAX Australia 2017 of the first public look of Florence. In it, Mountains reflects on about its reception by the public and the game’s upcoming release.
